definitions.title: adj.
definitions.body: from [[אַחַר]], coming after or behind (as a compar. or superl., acc. to the context); hence

definitions.title: a.
definitions.body: of place, behind, hindermost Ge 33:2, Ge 33:2; [[הָאַחֲרוֹן הַיׇּם]] the hinder (= the Western) sea (i.e. the Mediterranean: opp. [[הַיׇּם הַקַּדְמוֹנִי]] the front sea = the Dead Sea, the Semites, in defining the quarters of the heavens, turning naturally to the East, cf. [[קֶדֶם]] of the East, [[יׇמִין]], [[תֵּימָן]] of the South, above s. v. [[אָחוֹר]]

definitions.title: d.
definitions.body: and As. mat aḫarru ‘the Western land,’ of Phoenicia & Palestine) † De 11:24, De 34:2, Joe 2:20, Zec 14:8; Job 18:20 poet. [[אַחֲרׂנִים]] Ew Hi Di De the dwellers in the West (opp. [[קַדְמוֹנִים]]). More commonly

definitions.title: b.
definitions.body: of time, latter or last (acc. to context) Ex 4:8, De 24:3, 2Sa 19:12, Is 8:23, of God Is 44:6 (‖[[רִאשׁוֹן]]) Is 48:12 (do.) cf. Is 41:4; in genl. subsequent (vaguely), ´[[יוֹם א]] = time to come † Is 30:8, Pr 31:25 (but Ne 8:18 [[הַיוֹם]] ´[[הָאַ]] = the last day), ´[[אַ]]([[הָ]]) [[דּוֹר]]([[הַ]]) the following generation † De 29:21, Ps 48:14, Ps 78:4, Ps 78:6, Ps 102:19, [[אַחֲרׂנִים]]([[הָ]]) they that come after Job 18:20 (Ges Schl) Ec 1:11, Ec 4:16, but Is 41:4 the last, Job 19:25 [[וְאַחֲרוֹן עַל־עָפָר יׇקוּם]] and as one coming after (me) (and so able to establish my innocence when I am dead) will he ([[גּֽׁאֲלִי]] my Vindicator) arise upon the dust.—The fem. is used adverbially (cf. [[רִאשׁׂנׇה]]) = afterwards or at the last (acc. to context): (a) absol. † Da 11:29; (b) [[בָּאַחֲרוֹנׇה]] (opp. [[בָּרִאשׁׂנׇה]]) † De 13:10, De 17:7, 1Sa 29:2, 2Sa 2:26, 1Ki 17:13, Da 8:3; (g) ´[[לָאַ]] † Nu 2:31 (P) Ec 1:11.
